alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 27 at 4:16PM AKDT until March 28 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM AKDT MONDAY FOR TURNAGAIN PASS AND THE PORTAGE VALLEY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Visibility as low as one half mile at times in blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 15 inches are possible with highest snow accumulations through Turnagain Pass. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Turnagain Pass and the Portage Valley. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 1 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Winds will cause areas of blowing snow, significantly reducing visibilities. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strengthening frontal system will impact Turnagain Pass and the Portage Valley. Snow and blowing snow are expected due to cooler temperatures tonight, especially for Turnagain Pass. Portage Valley will hover just below freezing tonight with occasional periods of blowing snow. However, as temperatures slowly warm Monday morning expect blowing snow conditions to diminish across Portage Valley. Turnagain Pass is expected to stay cold enough to support blowing snow conditions through 1 PM Monday. Temperatures will then warm to near freezing Monday afternoon, which will end the threat of blowing snow. Though visibilities will improve, snow and elevated winds will continue across the region through Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
